nodes.documentation: Math operations with safety checks
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation:
Standard ERC20 token with Short Hand Attack and approve() race condition mitigation.
 * Based on code by FirstBlood:
https://github.com/Firstbloodio/token/blob/master/smart_contract/FirstBloodToken.sol
nodes.name: StandardToken

nodes.documentation:
Upgrade agent interface inspired by Lunyr.
 * Upgrade agent transfers tokens to a new version of a token contract.
Upgrade agent can be set on a token by the upgrade master.
 * Steps are
- Upgradeabletoken.upgradeMaster calls UpgradeableToken.setUpgradeAgent()
- Individual token holders can now call UpgradeableToken.upgrade()
  -> This results to call UpgradeAgent.upgradeFrom() that issues new tokens
  -> UpgradeableToken.upgrade() reduces the original total supply based on amount of upgraded tokens
 * Upgrade agent itself can be the token contract, or just a middle man contract doing the heavy lifting.
nodes.name: UpgradeAgent

nodes.documentation: Interface marker
nodes.name: isUpgradeAgent

nodes.documentation:
Upgrade amount of tokens to a new version.
   * Only callable by UpgradeableToken.
   * @param _tokenHolder Address that wants to upgrade its tokens
@param _amount Number of tokens to upgrade. The address may consider to hold back some amount of tokens in the old version.
nodes.name: upgradeFrom

nodes.documentation:
A token upgrade mechanism where users can opt-in amount of tokens to the next smart contract revision.
 * First envisioned by Golem and Lunyr projects.
nodes.name: UpgradeableToken

nodes.documentation: Somebody has upgraded some of his tokens.
nodes.name: Upgrade

nodes.documentation: New upgrade agent available.
nodes.name: UpgradeAgentSet

nodes.documentation: Upgrade master updated.
nodes.name: NewUpgradeMaster

nodes.documentation: Do not allow construction without upgrade master set.
nodes.name: UpgradeableToken

nodes.documentation: Allow the token holder to upgrade some of their tokens to a new contract.
nodes.name: upgrade

nodes.documentation: Set an upgrade agent that handles
nodes.name: setUpgradeAgent

nodes.documentation: Get the state of the token upgrade.
nodes.name: getUpgradeState

nodes.documentation:
Change the upgrade master.
   * This allows us to set a new owner for the upgrade mechanism.
nodes.name: setUpgradeMaster

nodes.documentation: Child contract can enable to provide the condition when the upgrade can begun.
nodes.name: canUpgrade

nodes.documentation:
Centrally issued Ethereum token.
 * We mix in burnable and upgradeable traits.
 * Token supply is created in the token contract creation and allocated to owner.
The owner can then transfer from its supply to crowdsale participants.
The owner, or anybody, can burn any excessive tokens they are holding.
nodes.name: CvcToken

nodes.documentation: Name and symbol were updated.
nodes.name: UpdatedTokenInformation

nodes.documentation:
Owner can update token information here.
   * It is often useful to conceal the actual token association, until
the token operations, like central issuance or reissuance have been completed.
In this case the initial token can be supplied with empty name and symbol information.
   * This function allows the token owner to rename the token after the operations
have been completed and then point the audience to use the token contract.
nodes.name: setTokenInformation
